guigraph
Class GameMouseListener

java.lang.Object
  com.mxgraph.swing.util.mxMouseAdapter
      guigraph.GameMouseListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class GameMouseListener
extends com.mxgraph.swing.util.mxMouseAdapter

This MouseListener reacts only on clicks on vertices of the basic graph. A click on a vertex causes that all neighbored vertices change the color. So the move corresponding to this click is executed. Therefore the connection over the #GamingGraph to the #Game is needed. The #GamingGraph is used to update the game and the graphics.

Author:
Irene Thesing

Constructor Detail

GameMouseListener

public GameMouseListener(GraphBoard owner,
                         com.mxgraph.swing.mxGraphComponent component,
                         boolean recordOn)
Creates a new GameMouseListener, which makes a move by clicking on a node. In this method the game is constructed out of the graph and the connection between both is stored in the #GamingGraph #gameGraph.

Parameters:
owner - the game board where the game takes place and the mouse listener shall change the fields.
component - the graph component where the game is shown.
recordOn - whether a record panel shall be shown.

GameMouseListener

public GameMouseListener(GraphBoard owner,
                         com.mxgraph.swing.mxGraphComponent graphComponent,
                         boolean recordOn,
                         boolean[] state)
Creates a new GameMouseListener, which makes a move by clicking on a node. In this method the game is constructed out of the graph and the connection between both is stored in the #GamingGraph #gameGraph.

Parameters:
owner - the game board where the game takes place and the mouse listener shall change the fields.
graphComponent - the graph component where the game is shown.
recordOn - whether a record panel shall be shown.
state - a starting state for the game.

public GamingGraph getGameGraph()
